marketNews.title: BEI announces major evaluation for LQ45 and IDX30 indices
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced a major evaluation for the LQ45 and IDX30 indices, effective from 1 November 2024 to 31 January 2025. For the LQ45 index, the additions are ADMR and SMRA, while GGRM and HRUM will be removed. For the IDX30 index, the additions are MAPI and MBMA, and the removals are BUKA and ITMG.

marketNews.title: Minister of Forestry Raja Juli Antoni says President Prabowo aims to finish IKN buildings in four years
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Minister of Forestry, Raja Juli Antoni said that President Prabowo Subianto wants to complete the construction of government and parliamentary buildings in the new capital, IKN, within four years. He also noted that the next presidential inauguration could be held in IKN in 2029. The comment came amid doubts about whether the Prabowo administration will continue the IKN project with the same priority as under President Joko Widodo, given that the state budget also needs to fund a free nutritious meals program. IKN has struggled to attract foreign investment, with the first foreign investment recorded in September 2024 when Chinese property developer Delonix Group invested IDR 500 billion to build a hotel and office building.

marketNews.title: Brent crude oil price falls 4.2% to US$72.88
marketNews.content: Brent crude oil for the December 2024 contract fell 4.2% to US$72.88 on Monday morning (28 Oct). The decline followed Israel’s retaliatory strike against Iran over the weekend, which did not hit Iranian oil or nuclear facilities, easing concerns about supply disruptions and broader conflict escalation. Iran’s state news agency IRNA reported that Israel struck several military sites in Tehran, Khuzestan, and Ilam provinces.

marketNews.title: Moch. Arief Cahyono says no plan to import 1.8 million tonnes of Vietnamese milk
marketNews.content: Moch. Arief Cahyono, Head of Public Relations and Public Information at the Ministry of Agriculture, said the ministry has no plan to import 1.8 million tonnes of Vietnamese milk for the free nutritious meals program. The comment came after Minister of Agriculture Andi Amran Sulaiman claimed on 25 Oct that a Vietnamese investor was interested in supplying 1.8 million tonnes of milk. Arief clarified that the minister meant the government is inviting the Vietnamese investor to set up a dairy industry in Indonesia to increase domestic milk production, not to import the product.

marketNews.title: MIND ID explores semiconductor production to support EV ecosystem
marketNews.content: The Director of Portfolio and Business Development at MIND ID, Dilo Seno Widagdo, said the company is exploring partnerships with several potential partners to produce semiconductors to support the electric‑vehicle ecosystem. One potential partner is Taiwan‑based Molicel, which would develop selenium for use as a semiconductor raw material. The required selenium could be sourced from the copper smelter owned by PT Freeport Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Vingroup launches $150 million VinVentures fund for SE Asian tech startups
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Vietnam’s conglomerate Vingroup JSC has launched a $150 million fund, VinVentures, to support technology startups across Southeast Asia, initially targeting Vietnamese startups before expanding to Singapore, Indonesia and the Philippines.

marketNews.title: Raja secures US$25 million term loan and IDR 60 billion guarantee from BMRI
marketNews.content: Raja (RAJA) signed a term‑loan facility of up to US$25 million and a bank‑guarantee facility of IDR 60 billion from Bank Mandiri (BMRI). Its subsidiary PT Triguna Internusa Pratama also signed an investment‑loan facility of US$19.8 million and an interest‑during‑construction loan of US$0.8 million from BMRI. The loans are intended for investment and project financing.

marketNews.title: Industry Ministry says government to prepare rescue plan for SRIL
marketNews.content: The Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said President Prabowo has instructed the Ministries of Industry, Finance, State‑Owned Enterprises and Labour to immediately study rescue options and schemes for Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL). The priority is to save SRIL employees from layoffs. The rescue plan will be presented as soon as the ministries finish drafting it. SRIL has also filed a legal appeal against the district court’s decision that declared the company bankrupt.

tickerNews.title: MSTI posts strong 3Q24 profit, net profit up 79% YoY
tickerNews.content: Mastersystem Infotama (MSTI) reported a net profit of IDR 149 billion in 3Q24 (+79% YoY, +155% QoQ). The result lifted 9‑month net profit to IDR 312 billion (+63% YoY), equal to 59% of Stockbit’s FY24 net‑profit estimate. The 9M23 net profit had been only 43% of FY23 actual. The strong profit was driven by robust revenue and efficient operating expenses. Revenue reached IDR 1.6 trillion in 3Q24 (+83% YoY, +119% QoQ), taking 9M24 revenue to IDR 3.5 trillion (+52% YoY). The company still has a backlog of new contracts worth IDR 2.4 trillion not yet recognized as revenue as of 1H24 and will start to be recognized in 3Q24. Management guided revenue growth of +19‑24% for FY24. Gross‑margin fell to 15.8% in 3Q24 (vs 21% in 3Q23, 19.1% in 2Q24), likely due to a large‑margin‑lower project. Opex was IDR 78 billion (+17% YoY, +6% QoQ), far slower than revenue growth. Other income was IDR 21 billion (3Q23: IDR 1 billion, 2Q24: IDR 4 billion), which the analyst estimates relates to a reversal of a provision for doubtful‑receivables. An earnings call will be held soon to discuss gross‑margin and opex dynamics and new‑contract developments.

tickerNews.title: JPFA net profit jumps 124% YoY in 9M24, beating expectations
tickerNews.content: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia (JPFA) recorded a net profit of IDR 617 billion (‑24% QoQ, ‑28% YoY) in 3Q24. The 9‑month net profit reached IDR 2.1 trillion versus IDR 937 billion in 9M23, beating expectations at 77%/89% of Stockbit/consensus FY24 forecasts. The 3Q24 profit decline was driven by lower operating margins across almost all segments except aquaculture. Segment operating profit fell to IDR 650 billion (‑5% QoQ, ‑22% YoY) and DOC profit fell to IDR 377 billion (‑18% QoQ, ‑36% YoY). The broiler segment posted a loss of IDR 16 billion (2Q24 profit IDR 389 billion, 3Q23 loss IDR 129 billion).

tickerNews.title: WINS posts US$6.3 million 3Q24 net profit, interim dividend announced
tickerNews.content: Wintermar Offshore Marine (WINS) posted a net profit of US$6.3 million (+264% YoY, ‑44% QoQ) in 3Q24. The 9‑month net profit reached US$19.7 million (+605% YoY), in line with expectations at 70.5% of Stockbit’s FY24 forecast. 3Q24 revenue grew 17% QoQ and 16% YoY, driven by a 35% QoQ and 30% YoY rise in Owned Vessel revenue and higher freight rates (+23% QoQ, +40% YoY). Operating profit was US$6 million (+99% QoQ, +119% YoY). The quarterly profit dip reflects a high‑base effect from a one‑off gain of US$17.4 million from the sale of three vessels in 2Q24. WINS will distribute an interim dividend of IDR 8 per share, with record‑date 5 Nov 2024 and payment on 21 Nov 2024, implying a 1.4% dividend yield.

tickerNews.title: BSSR announces US$0.01146 interim dividend, 3.9% yield
tickerNews.content: Baramulti Suksessarana (BSSR) will distribute an interim dividend for FY2024 of US$0.01146 (US$30 million), equivalent to IDR 180 per share assuming an exchange rate of IDR 15.729. The dividend will be payable on 21 Nov 2024 after a cum‑date on 5 Nov 2024. The share price on Monday (28/10) was IDR 4,650, implying a 3.9% dividend yield.

tickerNews.title: PGEO posts US$38 million 3Q24 net profit, EBITDA margin falls to 83.1%
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) posted a net profit of US$38 million (‑7% YoY, ‑23% QoQ) in 3Q24, pressured by a foreign‑exchange loss of US$4 million (3Q23 profit US$2 million, 2Q24 profit US$12 million). The 9‑month net profit was US$134 million (+0.4% YoY), equal to 84% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Although the result slightly exceeded expectations, it was driven by higher financial income. Operating profit for the 9‑month period was US$171 million (‑5% YoY), 73% of the consensus. EBITDA margin fell to 83.1% (‑140 bps YoY) as cost of sales rose 5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DOID subsidiary signs coal‑mining services amendment with PT Indonesia Pratama
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur’s subsidiary PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama signed an amendment to the coal‑mining services agreement with PT Indonesia Pratama, a subsidiary of Bayan Resources (BYAN). The amendment, effective 2024‑2035, targets an overburden removal of 1.827 billion bcm and an estimated coal production of 465 million tonnes, increasing volume from the current level. The amendment is expected to generate approximately IDR 107.8 trillion (US$7.7 billion) of revenue for PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama.

tickerNews.title: Bank Jago posts 27% QoQ net profit rise in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago (ARTO) reported a net profit of IDR 35.9 billion (+27% QoQ, +267% YoY) in 3Q24, taking 9‑month net profit to IDR 85.8 billion (+71% YoY), 70% of the FY24 consensus. The 3Q24 profit was driven by a 12% QoQ decline in provisions and an 8.3% QoQ rise in non‑interest income. Net interest income was IDR 369 billion (+1.6% QoQ, ‑2% YoY), bringing 9M24 NII to IDR 1.1 trillion (‑11% YoY).

tickerNews.title: CMRY posts modest 3Q24 profit increase
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) posted a net profit of IDR 353 billion (+2.6% YoY, ‑15% QoQ) in 3Q24, bringing 9‑month net profit to IDR 1.2 trillion (+19.7% YoY), 76% of the FY24 consensus. Revenue grew 13.1% YoY (‑1.2% QoQ) and gross‑margin expanded to 45.5% (+310 bps YoY, +70 bps QoQ). Operating profit rose to IDR 496 billion (+24% YoY, +10.9% QoQ). The quarterly profit was pressured by a IDR 63 billion finance cost, reversing a prior financial‑income gain of IDR 84 billion in 2Q24 and IDR 28 billion in 3Q23.

tickerNews.title: BFIN reports 32% QoQ net profit rise in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: BFI Finance Indonesia (BFIN) posted a net profit of IDR 429 billion (+32% QoQ, +31% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a 9‑month net profit of IDR 1.1 trillion (‑5.2% YoY), 75% of the FY24 consensus. Revenue was flat at IDR 1.6 trillion (+3% QoQ, +2% YoY), making 9M24 revenue IDR 4.7 trillion (‑1.2% YoY). The 3Q24 profit increase was mainly due to a 25.5% QoQ and 36.5% YoY drop in provision expenses (CKPN) to IDR 178 billion.

tickerNews.title: PT PP posts 130% QoQ net profit increase in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: PT PP (PTPP) posted a net profit of IDR 120.3 billion (+130% QoQ, ‑16% YoY) in 3Q24, lifting 9‑month net profit to IDR 267.3 billion (+12% YoY), 71% of the FY24 consensus. The quarterly profit surge was driven by a modest 4.3% QoQ rise in interest expense, a 13‑percentage‑point drop in effective tax rate, and a larger share of net profit allocated to the parent after a loss at a minority‑held project. Revenue for 9M24 was IDR 14 trillion, with gross‑margin falling to 11.8% (vs 14% in 9M23).

tickerNews.title: ERAL posts 14% YoY net profit increase in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) posted a net profit of IDR 67 billion (+14% YoY, +36% QoQ) in 3Q24, bringing 9‑month net profit to IDR 157 billion (‑3.9% YoY). The 3Q24 result improved versus the prior two quarters (1Q24 –20% YoY, 2Q24 –9% YoY) thanks to a 38% YoY and 29% QoQ revenue increase and a gross‑margin rise to 14.2% (vs 12.5% in 1Q24, 14% in 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy signs Mitsubishi Power contract to retrofit Darajat Unit 3
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy, through its subsidiary Star Energy Geothermal Darajat II, signed a contract with Mitsubishi Power to retrofit the Darajat Unit 3 geothermal plant, increasing capacity from 121 MW to 129 MW. The retrofit, detailed in a Reuters news release, will be completed by Q3 2026.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Forestry says IKN buildings to be completed within four years
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian Ministry of Forestry announced that Minister Raja Juli Antoni said President Prabowo aims to finish the construction of government and parliamentary buildings in the new capital, IKN, within four years, and hopes the next presidential inauguration can be held in IKN in 2029. The statement came amid doubts about the continuation of the IKN project at the same priority level as under President Joko Widodo, given the state budget also needs to fund a free‑nutritious‑meal program. IKN’s first foreign investment was recorded in September 2024 when Chinese developer Delonix Group invested IDR 500 billion to build a hotel and office.

tickerNews.title: MIND ID explores semiconductor production for EV ecosystem
tickerNews.content: MIND ID’s Director of Portfolio and Business Development, Dilo Seno Widagdo, said the company is exploring partnerships with several potential partners to produce semiconductors for the electric‑vehicle ecosystem. One potential partner is Taiwan’s Molicel, which would develop selenium for use as a semiconductor raw material. The required selenium could be sourced from PT Freeport Indonesia’s copper smelter.

tickerNews.title: Vingroup launches $150 million VinVentures fund for SE Asian tech startups
tickerNews.content: Vietnam’s Vingroup JSC announced a $150 million fund, VinVentures, to back Southeast Asian tech startups, initially focusing on Vietnam and later expanding to Singapore, Indonesia and the Philippines.

tickerNews.title: BEI announces major evaluation for LQ45 and IDX30 indices
tickerNews.content: The Jakarta Stock Exchange (BEI) announced a major evaluation of the LQ45 and IDX30 indices, effective 1 Nov 2024‑31 Jan 2025. Additions to LQ45 are ADMR and SMRA; removals are GGRM and HRUM. Additions to IDX30 are MAPI and MBMA; removals are BUKA and ITMG.

tickerNews.title: Industry Ministry says government to prepare rescue plan for SRIL
tickerNews.content: Minister of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said President Prabowo has instructed the Ministries of Industry, Finance, State‑Owned Enterprises and Labour to immediately study rescue options for Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL). The priority is to save SRIL employees from layoffs. The rescue plan will be presented as soon as the ministries finish drafting it. SRIL has also filed a legal appeal against the district court’s bankruptcy ruling.
